abstract.text: Exposes a 2D atlas texture as a set of tiles for a
resource.

inlineContent.text: An atlas is a grid of tiles laid out on a texture. Each tile in the grid must be exposed using
. Those tiles are then indexed using their coordinates in the grid.
Each tile can also have a size in the grid coordinates, making it more or less cells in the atlas.
Alternatives version of a tile can be created using
, which are then indexed using an alternative ID. The main tile (the one in the grid), is accessed with an alternative ID equal to 0.
Each tile alternate has a set of properties that is defined by the source’s
layers. Those properties are stored in a TileData object that can be accessed and modified using
As TileData properties are stored directly in the TileSetAtlasSource resource, their properties might also be set using

abstract.text: Types that conform to VariantRepresentable can be stored directly in
with no conversion.  These include all of the Variant types from Godot (for
example
), Godot objects (those that subclass
SwiftGodot.Object) as well as the built-in Swift types UInt8, Int64 and Double.
